availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Patsy Hickman Estill (Oldham County, Kentucky, resident and farmer)

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, resident and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Benjamin Estill. Mother of Susan Estill Talandier and Alice Estill Warfield. Resident of Oldham County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1850. Owned Guy [Unknown] in Oldham County in 1856. Owned Jesse [Unknown] in Oldham County in 1859. Farmer in Oldham County in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1, p. 149A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1, p. 359.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 895.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 170A-B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 559B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994051, Oldham County Births.
"Jefferson Circuit Court," Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, KY), January 12, 1859, p. 1.
"A Remarkable Woman," The Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), August 26, 1895, p. 6.
"Mrs. P. Estill (1800-1895)," Find A Grave, Memorial 82715501, accessed March 1, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/82715501.
